docs.snippet: Observers say the Republican nominee’s warnings of voter fraud in Pennsylvania belie his real target: predominately black precincts like those in Philadelphia that traditionally vote for Democrats....
docs.lead_paragraph: Observers say the Republican nominee’s warnings of voter fraud in Pennsylvania belie his real target: predominately black precincts like those in Philadelphia that traditionally vote for Democrats.
docs.abstract: Donald Trump has suggested he may lose presidential election due to Democrats taking advantage of weak voter identification laws, charge that has sparked outrage from Democrats and alarm among some Republicans; Trump's warnings, which have tinge of racially suggestive language and go beyond his party's past calls for stricter identification requirements, imply Democrats are trying to steal election with fraudulent voting.

headline.main: Donald Trump, a ‘Rigged’ Election and the Politics of Race
headline.print_headline: Trump, Claims of ‘Rigged’ Vote and Issues of Racial Politics

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

docs.snippet: As campaign documents revealed a spending gap between Mr. Trump and Hillary Clinton, some Republican leaders called for focusing resources on candidates down the ballot....
docs.lead_paragraph: As campaign documents revealed a spending gap between Mr. Trump and Hillary Clinton, some Republican leaders called for focusing resources on candidates down the ballot.
docs.abstract: Donald J Trump's presidential campaign is relying heavily on Republican Party organizations to help carry out crucial campaign functions like get-out-the-vote efforts, fund-raising and digital outreach; campaign has remained largely bare-bones, despite increase in amount of cash it has on hand, and many Republicans are urging party officials to divert resources to fight to retain majorities in Congress.

headline.main: Donald Trump, With Bare-Bones Campaign, Relies on G.O.P. for Vital Tasks
headline.print_headline: Trump Campaign Relying on G.O.P. for Vital Tasks

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and RACHEL SHOREY

docs.snippet: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton could be discussing in more detail their tax plans, a serious topic on which they have clear differences....
docs.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton could be discussing in more detail their tax plans, a serious topic on which they have clear differences.

headline.main: The Debate Over Taxes That Isn’t Happening

byline.original: By ALBERT R. HUNT | BLOOMBERG VIEW

docs.snippet: As both presidential candidates campaign against it, the White House is negotiating with Republicans in Congress to ratify the largest regional trade agreement ever....
docs.lead_paragraph: As both presidential candidates campaign against it, the White House is negotiating with Republicans in Congress to ratify the largest regional trade agreement ever.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama, amid opposition, is planning final push for approval of Trans-Pacific Partnership, trade agreement with United States and 11 Pacific Rim nations; both Obama and congressional Republicans want to approve pact, but are delaying vote until after presidential election for fear of inciting even more rebuke from presidential nominees.

headline.main: Obama Readies One Last Push for Trans-Pacific Partnership
headline.print_headline: Amid Opposition, T.P.P. Gets a Final Push

docs.snippet: She’s winning white moderate conservatives — just as Nixon did in the 1960s....
docs.lead_paragraph: She’s winning white moderate conservatives — just as Nixon did in the 1960s.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Joseph Crespino recounts how so-called Southern Strategy helped Republicans gain electoral majorities in South in 1960s; holds Hillary Clinton's good numbers in traditionally Republican Southern states could indicate realignment of region's politics with profound implications for future of country.

headline.main: Why Hillary Clinton Might Win Georgia

docs.snippet: Of conspiracy theories and climate action....
docs.lead_paragraph: Of conspiracy theories and climate action.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column calls Donald Trump's visit to flood-affected parts of Louisiana ham-handed political exploitation of disaster; holds Trump's policies on global warming would exacerbate conditions behind increased frequency of extreme weather events; underscores degree to which presidential election will determine future of efforts to combat climate change.

docs.snippet: Mr. Hannity has given Mr. Trump and those around him suggestions on strategy and messaging while still hosting his show on Fox News....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Hannity has given Mr. Trump and those around him suggestions on strategy and messaging while still hosting his show on Fox News.
docs.abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column faults Sean Hannity for openly advising and promoting Republican presidential nominee Donald J Trump while still hosting his show on Fox News Channel without fear he is injuring his or network's journalistic integrity; notes departure of Roger Ailes may cause media corporation to rethink its partiality.

headline.main: Sean Hannity Turns Adviser in the Service of Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Pundit Turns Adviser in the Service of Trump

docs.snippet: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump urged the Justice Department on Monday to appoint a special prosecutor to investigate if donors to the Clinton Foundation got special treatment from the State Department when it was run by his Democrati...
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump urged the Justice Department on Monday to appoint a special prosecutor to investigate if donors to the Clinton Foundation got special treatment from the State Department when it was run by his Democratic rival, Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Trump Calls for Special Prosecutor to Investigate Clinton Foundation
headline.print_headline: Trump Calls for Special Prosecutor to Investigate Clinton Foundation

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton heads into the fall out front in enough states to give her at least a tie in the Electoral College, meaning that a victory in any of the several states now considered a toss-up would be enough to push her over the top and into the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton heads into the fall out front in enough states to give her at least a tie in the Electoral College, meaning that a victory in any of the several states now considered a toss-up would be enough to push her over the top and into the White House.
